name: Electrode

attacks.name: Chain Lightning
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon isn't Colorless, this attack does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon of the same type as the Defending Pokémon (including your own).

flavorText: It stores electrical energy under very high pressure. It often explodes with little or no provocation.

strengths: 90 HP is solid for a Stage 1
Chain Lightning can spread damage to opponent's bench
Only 1 retreat cost for easy switching
Tackle provides early game chip damage
weaknesses: Chain Lightning also damages your own benched Pokemon of the same type
Fighting weakness is problematic in Haymaker meta
3 energy for only 20 base damage is inefficient
Colorless Pokemon immune to Chain Lightning spread
synergies: Electabuzz - provides Lightning support but be careful of self-damage
Plus Power - boost Chain Lightning damage
counters: Colorless Pokemon - immune to Chain Lightning spread
High HP Pokemon - 20 damage is underwhelming

competitiveHistory: This is the non-holo rare version of Electrode, identical to card #2 but without the holographic foil treatment. It was included to make Electrode more accessible to players. Jungle Electrode was not considered competitively viable compared to Base Set Electrode with its Buzzap Pokemon Power.

rulings.ruling: Chain Lightning does not damage benched Pokemon if the Defending Pokemon is Colorless type.
Chain Lightning damages ALL benched Pokemon of the same type as the Defending Pokemon, including your own.
The bench damage from Chain Lightning is not affected by Weakness or Resistance.
